findings.title: ChainlinkPriceOracleV2._price Does Not Consult Decimal Values
findings.description: The function `_price` queries various Chainlink oracles, however, the decimal value associated with each price feed is not considered. This may lead to over/undervaluing the price of the `underlying` token being considered.

findings.title: FixedEurPriceOracle May Return Stale Prices
findings.description: The function `_price` consults several oracles without ensuring that the returned data is recent. This may lead to stale pricing results and potential arbitrage.

findings.title: Unintended Code Removal In Comptroller.mintAllowed
findings.description: The following snippet was removed, however, it seems this check is necessary based on the function name.

findings.title: Incorrect getUnderlyingPrice Computation
findings.description: The function `getUnderlyingPrice` appears to be copied from `FixedEthPriceOracle.sol`, and therefore relates the token price to ETH, not EUR.

findings.title: Unused Constant TokenErrorReporter.UTILIZATION_ABOVE_MAX
findings.description: The constant `UTILIZATION_ABOVE_MAX` is newly defined, but it is not used anywhere.

findings.title: Unchecked Function Arguments
findings.description: In `ChainlinkPriceOracleV2.constructor`, `_admin` should ensure it is non-zero.

findings.title: Allowance Double-Spend Exploit
findings.description: The contract is vulnerable to the allowance double-spend exploit as with other ERC20 tokens.

findings.title: Inconsistency Use of minPeriod In _workable and _updateable
findings.description: When checking the timestamp of the most recent observation, `_workable` uses `minPeriod` whereas `_updateable` does not consider `minPeriod`, only referring to `MIN_TWAP_TIME`.
